div.l: And thought all this ne is done but for a wyle
They wene þat no man may them by guyle
But by my thryfte yet shal I blere her͗e eye
For all the sleight in her philosophye

The more wole I stele crekes that they makequeint Creke
pr
The more wol I stele whan I take
In stede of flour͗e than wole I yef hem brynne
The grettest clerkes ben nat the wysest men
As whilom to þe wolf thus spak the mare
Of all her arte counte I nat a taare
Out of þe dore he goth full preuyly
Whan þat he saw his tyme full softely
He loketh vp and doıı̄un till he hath founde
The clerkes hors ther͗e as he stood y bounde
By hynde the mylle vnder a leuesell
And to the hors he goth full faire and wel
He strippeth of the brydel right a none
And whan the hors was lose he gan to gone
To warde the fenne ther͗e wilde mares renne
And forth wᵗith wyhe thurgh thyk and thenne
This myller goth ageyn no worde he he seide
But doth his note and wᵗith these clerkes pleyed
Tyl that ther corne was faire and wel yground
And when the mele was sakked and wel ybounde
This Iohn goth out and fyndeth his hors a waye
And gan to crye harrowe and welaweye
Our͗e hors is loste Aleyn by goddes bones
Steppe on thy feet come on man all at ones
Allas our͗e wardeyn hath his palfray lorne
This Aleyn all forgate bothe mele and corne
All was out of his mende his husbondrye
What whilke way is he gon he gan to crye
The wyfe come lepyng in warde at a renne
She seith allas your͗e hors goth to fenne
With wilde mares as faste as he may goo
Vn thank come on his hand that bonde hym soo
And he þat better shuld haue knytte the reyne
Allas Aleyn qᵈuod Iohn for crystes peyne
Ley doun̄ thyne swerd and I wole myne also
I am full swyfte god wote as is a roo
By goddes herte he shall nat scape vs bathe
Why ne had ye put the capul in the lathe
Ille ail by god aleyn thou art a fonne
These sely clerkes haue full faste y ronne
To ward the fenne bothe Aleyn and eke Iohn
And when the myller seye that they were gon̄
He half a busshel of ther floᵘur hath y take
And badde his wyfe go knede it in a cake
And seide I trowe the clerkes wer͗e a ferde
Yet can a myller make a clerkes berde
For all ther arte yet lete them go ther weye
Lo wher͗e they gon ya lete the children̄ pleye
They gete hem nat so swyftely by my crowne
These sely cr cr clerkes renne vp and downe
With kepe kepe · stand stande · ioste and warderere
Go whistell yow and I shal kepe hym here
But shortely til it was verray nyght
They coude nat though they dede all her myght
Her caple catche he ranne alwey so faste
Till in a dyche they caught hym at the laste
Wery and wete as beste is in the reyne
Cometh sely Iohn and with hym cometh Aleyn̄
Allas qᵈuod Iohn the day that I was borne
Now arn we dryuen til hethyng and īn sco Erasure not visible in manuscript imageto skorne pr
Oure corne is stolen men wole vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn and hise felawes alle
And namely the myller welaweye
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by the weye
To warde the mylle and bayard in his honde
The myller sittyng by the fier he fonde
For it was nyght and ferther myght he nought
But for the love of god they hym be sought
Of herborgh and of ease as for her peny
The myller seid a yen if ther be eny
Suche as it is yet ye shall haue your͗e parte
Myne hous is streigth but ye haue lerned arte
Ye can by argumente make a place
A myle brode of twenty foot of space
Lete se now if this place may suffise
Or make it rūmmer with speche as is yoᵘur guyse
Now Symond seid this Iohn by seynt Cuthberte
Ay art thow mery and þat is faire and and answerde
I haue herd sey men shall take of two thyngges
Suche as he he fynde or take suche as he bryngges
But specially I pray the oste dere
Gete vs som mete and drynk and make vs chere
And we wole paye truly at the fulle
